intro: Cordyline flabelliformis, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a striking evergreen plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, sword-shaped leaves that are often brightly colored. The plant produces striking panicles of white to pink flowers, which appear in spring and summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has cultural significance in Māori traditions. Cordyline flabelliformis is adaptable to various growing conditions but thrives in well-drained soil and full sun.
